sources.title: Aces Wild (1936) HARRY CAREY
sources.description:
Stars: Harry Carey, Gertrude Messinger, Theodore Lorch
Writer/Director: Harry Fraser

Cheyenne arrives in Durango and runs up against an old enemy, a con man who brings an armored safe into bankless towns and dupes residents into storing their valuables in it... before absconding with its contents! 

Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: Harry Carey (1878â€“1947) began acting in 1910 to become one of Silent Film's earliest superstars and successfully transitioned into "talkies." He made 260 films and is best remembered as a cowboy. So much so, John Ford and John Wayne closed their iconic western THE SEARCHERS (1956) with a visual homage to Harry Carey.

metadata.Plot: Cheyenne rides into Durango and runs into his old enemy Kelton. Kelton's game is to bring his safe to a town without a bank and let the townspeople put their valuables in it. Then he grabs the loot and flees. But Cheyenne is on to his scheme and finding the safe empty, gets the Sheriff to join in the chase.
metadata.Actors: Harry Carey, Gertrude Messinger, Theodore Lorch
